str2: (a) gen: with, in company with, (b) acc: (1) behind, beyond, after, of place, (2) after, of time, with nouns, neut. of adjectives.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Lord, master, sir; the Lord. From kuros; supreme in authority, i.e. controller; by implication, Master.
Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.
A prolonged form of an otherwise obsolete verb; to talk, i.e. Utter words.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To take up, raise; I pick up, take on board; I carry off, lead away. From ana and lambano; to take up.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
Perhaps from the same as oros; the sky; by extension, heaven; by implication, happiness, power, eternity; specially, the Gospel.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: Another form for kathezomai; to seat down, i.e. Set; intransitively, to sit; figuratively, to settle.
From out, out from among, from, suggesting from the interior outwards. A primary preposition denoting origin, from, out.
On the right hand, right hand, right. From dechomai; the right side or hand.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.
